body_html:
@peterjc123 thanks so much for your hard work on this! I'm trying to get fastai working on Windows at the moment, and your conda package of pytorch installed flawlessly :) I've got some performance issues - is this the right place to mention them? Or is there a better place for me to discuss this? (If so, please let me know and I'll delete this message and move it to the right place.)

I have CUDA 8.0 installed on Windows 10, and cuDNN 6.0. I'm using the latest Anaconda Python 3.6 and all packages are updated. Hardware is a new Surface Book 15 inch, GTX1060 mobile GPU. Dual booting to Linux shows 80 seconds to do one forward pass through the Kaggle Dogs & Cats dataset with Resnet50. However the exact same notebook under Windows takes 315 seconds. So about 4x slower under Windows.

I've used Nvidia control panel to set integrated graphics as default, and confirmed with nvidia-smi nothing else is accessing the nvidia GPU.

Is this performance difference expected? Is there something I should be doing differently?

Sorry to bother you - thanks again for your amazing work :)
